title: [Self-Directed] Micro-Instructional Design for Remote Education: Utilizing the TAPPA Process

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with foundational online learning tools and general understanding of digital environments
context.additional_context: Course focused on developing language learning modules and webinars in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can independently develop three or more micro-instructional design scenarios using the five stages of the TAPPA process (Target, Accomplishment, Past, Prototype, Artifact).
Learners can produce at least two language learning modules applicable in Web 2.0/3.0 environments through project-based assessment.
Learners can identify and apply five or more micro-instructional strategies to enhance learner engagement in smartphone-based limited-technology environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
